intro: Symplocos fulvipes, commonly known as the yellow-flowered evergreen, is a member of the Ericaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green in color. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
